text:
The XSL used by CvsChangeLog produces bad HTML.  The biggest problem is that the
stylesheet is in the body, while it must be in head.  For example, the gtkhtml
component in Ximian evolution then doesn't use the CSS at all.

I'll attach a patch, which fixes this and a couple of other things, making the
XSL output HTML 4.01 Strict.
creator: ville.skytta@iki.fi

text:
Created attachment 2715
Fix for HTML output of CvsChangeLog
creator: ville.skytta@iki.fi

text:
Thanks for the patch. Committed to CVS head.
I did a couple of changes.
- We cannot apply the strict dtd because of some invalid html attribute, we 
have to work more on the css for that. So I switched to a loose dtd 
(transitional)
- I changed the font size because it was hurting my eyes (ok I agree, I'm 
biased, if you don't like it I will revert the change )
- I changed to & as &amp; so that it prints & in the html 
attribute instead of the invalid &.

I have no error in the W3C HTML validator.
creator: sbailliez@apache.org

text:
Thanks for applying the patch.  However, I noticed that the patch I sent didn't
contain two changes I did (I was testing with a static HTML output of the task
and "backported" the fixes into the XSL).

About the & stuff, I thought that the XSL transformer would handle escaping
that stuff for me, I have a feeling that we might have hit a transformer bug
here.  I can't verify that now, but would placing the <xsl:choose> *inside* the
<xsl:attribute> for the cvsweb links work differently?

I'll attach another patch which addresses these.  I'm changing back to the
Strict DTD, which should work now, unless I forgot something again :)  Please
apply at least the second hunk...

By the way, tagdiff.xsl needs similar fixes as changelog.xsl, at least the
stylesheet placement seems to be broken there (should be in HEAD).
creator: ville.skytta@iki.fi

text:
I checked the &amp it's a xalan bug (2.4d1) . I checked with <xsl-text disable-
output-escaping="yes|no"> this has zero effects, it's never escaped and it 
works fine with saxon 7.1. I will report that to the xalan folks.
creator: sbailliez@apache.org
